description: Commands to manage all the clusters in a private cloud, excluding the first cluster which is the default management cluster.

commands.name: az vmware cluster create
commands.summary: Create a cluster in a private cloud.
commands.syntax:
az vmware cluster create --cluster-name
                         --private-cloud
                         --resource-group
                         --sku
                         [--cluster-size]
                         [--hosts]
                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                         [--vsan-datastore-name]

commands.name: az vmware cluster delete
commands.summary: Delete a cluster in a private cloud, excluding the first cluster which is the default management cluster.
commands.syntax:
az vmware cluster delete [--cluster-name]
                         [--ids]
                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                         [--private-cloud]
                         [--resource-group]
                         [--subscription]
                         [--yes]

commands.name: az vmware cluster list
commands.summary: List clusters in a private cloud, excluding the first cluster which is the default management cluster.

commands.name: az vmware cluster list-zones
commands.summary: List hosts by zone in a cluster in a private cloud, including the first cluster which is the default management cluster.

commands.name: az vmware cluster show
commands.summary: Get a cluster by name in a private cloud, excluding the first cluster which is the default management cluster.

commands.name: az vmware cluster update
commands.summary: Update a cluster in a private cloud, excluding the first cluster which is the default management cluster.
commands.syntax:
az vmware cluster update [--add]
                         [--cluster-name]
                         [--cluster-size]
                         [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                         [--hosts]
                         [--ids]
                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                         [--private-cloud]
                         [--remove]
                         [--resource-group]
                         [--set]
                         [--subscription]
                         [--vsan-datastore-name]

commands.name: az vmware cluster wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
